headline.main: Bellevue Hospital and its "Transferred" Cases.; To the Editor of the New- York Daily Times:

docs.lead_paragraph: An article appeared in yesterday's TIMES on an inquest held by Coroner HILTON, at Blackwell's Island Hospital, on the body of JOHN HANLON, "who was shamefully treated at Bellevue Hospital."
docs.snippet: An article appeared in yesterday's TIMES on an inquest held by Coroner HILTON, at Blackwell's Island Hospital, on the body of JOHN HANLON, "who was shamefully treated at Bellevue Hospital."

headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; Pacific Railroad Bill--Gen. Wool--Emigrant Passenger Bill--Army Bills--Express Mail to California.

docs.lead_paragraph: The fight on the Pacific Railroad begins to be close in the House;--and to morrow will probably decide the fate of the measure, under its present "grooming." I do not yet believe it will be passed
docs.snippet: The fight on the Pacific Railroad begins to be close in the House;--and to morrow will probably decide the fate of the measure, under its present "grooming." I do not yet believe it will be passed

byline.original: Special Correspondence of the N. Y. Daily Times

headline.main: A Long Island Centennarian.; To the Editor of the New-York DailyTimes:

docs.lead_paragraph: There is now living in Aquebogue, near Jamesport, an excellent man, JOHN WOODHULL, who has attained to the age of one hundred years, his birthday being the 7th January 1855. The writer
docs.snippet: There is now living in Aquebogue, near Jamesport, an excellent man, JOHN WOODHULL, who has attained to the age of one hundred years, his birthday being the 7th January 1855. The writer

docs.lead_paragraph: A very interesting case of Life Insurance was tried last week in one of the Cincinnati Courts. A gentleman, as we gather from the Gazette, being on the point of leaving that city for St. Louis, made arrangements for taking out a policy on his life for the benefit of his wife, in the sum of $2,500.

headline.main: FROM NEW-ORLEANS.; New-Orleans During the Holidays--State of Business--Public Improvements--Destruction of the Mechanics' Institute--Balloon Ascension--Theatricals.

docs.lead_paragraph: No city in the Union can present a more lively scence of gayety and enjoyment than New Orleans during the holidays. The whirl and bustle of business give place for a brief space to the greater noise and confusion of amusement, while the shrines of Mammon are abandoned for the temples of pleasure. The streets and places of public

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; THE MERCHANTS' BANK ROBBERY. Geographical Society. The Twelfth Regiment Under Orders. Public School Society. Broadway Blockaded.. Delmonico's Sold. Shameful Treatment of Patients at the Bellevue Hospital--Death, and Verdict of Censure. A Competent Councilman.

docs.lead_paragraph: Since the extensive robbery of $25,000 in gold coin was perpetrated at the Merchants' Bank in Wall-street, the police have been on the ?? to ferret out the robbery. Yesterday a clue was obtained, through information furnished the authorities by two private citizens. It appears the missing gold was placed in small bags, containing $5,600 each, in twenty dollar gold pieces, of recent issues at the United States Mint in Philadelphia.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; CITY POLITICS. Organization of the Old Men's Whig General Committee. Association of Exempt Firemen. The Firemen's Ball. The National Poultry Show. The Crimean Campaign and Siege of Sebastopol. Movements of Commodore Perry. Forgery Detected. Seizure of Ball Cartridges. Anticipated Riot. Reckless Driving--Heavy Damages. Another Robbery in Broadway. SUPREME COURT--GENERAL TERM. COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS.

docs.lead_paragraph: A special meeting of the Senior Whig General Committee was held last evening at the Broadway House, for the purpose of organizing for the year 1855. The Committee was called to order by ARCHIBALD COCHRANE, Esq., Chairman pro tem, and at once proceeded to ballot for the election of President. The contest was left between Messrs. HALL,

headline.main: ONE WEEK; LATER FROM CALIFORNIA. ARRIVAL OF THE NORTHERN LIGHT. $533,270 OF GOLD. STAE?ING, MURDER, LOVE, JEALOUSY. A DESTRUCTIVE FIRE. OREGON AND WASHINGTON TERRITORIES. LOWER CALIFORNIA RUMORS. Marriages---Deaths---Markets---Theatricals, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Northern Light, E. L. TINKLEPAUGH, Commander arrived on Monday morning, from San Juan ria Key West, with tow hundred and twenty-?? passengers, and $533,270 in gold dust on freight. We are in?? to ?? Co.s Express for early papers. The Purser does not vouchsafe as anything in his line. For the items that the Purser's courtesy generally provides us with, our thanks are due to other parties.
